summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with Dr. , the New York City medical examiner who performed the autopsy on Jeffrey Epstein. The interview covers her background, the autopsy findings, her conclusion that the cause of death was hanging and the manner was suicide, and her responses to questions about the ligature evidence, potential injuries, and external pressures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the autopsy and investigation. Found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's brother who hired an independent medical examiner to observe the autopsy.

persons.name: Michael Baden
persons.context: Medical examiner hired by Mark Epstein to be present for Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy.

connections.description: Dr. performed the autopsy on Jeffrey Epstein and determined his cause and manner of death.
Mark Epstein is the brother of Jeffrey Epstein and hired an independent examiner for the autopsy.
Mark Epstein hired Dr. Michael Baden to be present as an independent observer during his brother's autopsy.
Both are DOJ/OIG special agents conducting the joint interview of Dr. .
is the General Counsel for the Office of Chief Medical Examiner, present during the interview of Dr. .

events.title: Autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Dr. performs the autopsy on Jeffrey Epstein at the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

events.title: Previous suicide attempt by Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a noose around his neck in an apparent previous suicide attempt while in custody.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: OIG Interview with Medical Examiner
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a recorded interview with Dr. regarding her autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
Dane County Medical Examiner's Office, Madison, Wisconsin
Columbia University School of Graduate Studies
keyFacts: Dr. concluded Jeffrey Epstein's cause of death was hanging and the manner was suicide, based on autopsy findings including a ligature furrow, petechial hemorrhages, and fractures of the thyroid cartilage and hyoid bone consistent with hanging.
The medical examiner noted the absence of defensive wounds, struggle marks, or other trauma that would suggest homicide or an altercation.
Toxicology tests showed no substances in Epstein's system at the time of death.
There was confusion and inconsistency regarding which piece of material was the actual ligature used in the hanging, with at least two different potential "nooses" photographed at the scene.
Dr. stated that no one attempted to coerce or bribe her into ruling Epstein's death a suicide, though she received unpleasant calls from Epstein's family who were unhappy with the determination.
